p.s: I am a student at a grammar school in Cologne, Germany, and I am writing to you today, because I am very much in disbelief of your choice on takingShakespeare off the school curriculum.
Dealing withShakespeare in school has many advantages.
The students get an even wider inside into modern drama and poetry by having the background on Shakespeare.
He inspired a lot of modern artists with his work.

Now you might say that the old elizabethanElizabethan languageShakespeare uses, can cause confusion among the students, but I am in belief that after examining three to four sonnets, the students will understand and benefit from those.
In addition the language of the poet uses, is in many ways beneficial for an englishEnglish class.
For example will learn the students not only to analyze the massive amount of devices that are used in every sonnet but also learn some thing for their own lives.
Shakespeare delivered topics which are still relevant in 2021, being loved or topics that evolve around human kindhumankind.
Many students do also enjoy presenting the work ofShakespeare as it is meant to present.
On the basis of the given aspects I would kindly ask to reconsider your choice.
I am certain if there would be a way to determine also the opinion of others, a school wide survey would be a good democratic way.
